description: BraveRats, first released as R, is a simple and short simultaneous action selection game for two that's played with cards. Both players have a hand of eight cards, numbered 0 to 7, with each card having a special power. Both players choose a card, then reveal them simultaneously. The highest card wins the round, and players play until someone has won four rounds. The cards' special powers greatly influence the game.

User summary:

A Dominion-esque Japanese small press deck building game based on web-based role playing game "False Island". All players start with a small set of cards containing money and some victory points, and may each turn play cards from their hand to purchase better cards. The cards available for purchase vary each turn, as they are drawn and displayed 4 at a time from a shuffled pile of various cards. Money cards and victory point cards can always be drawn.

User summary:

Myon's Errand Game (ã¿ã‚‡ã‚“ã®ãŠä½¿ã„ã‚²ãƒ¼ãƒ ) is a "Great Dalmuti" type card game featuring characters of Shrine Maiden fame. The card deck consists of cards numbered 1–15 and a special power. Each player gets 7 cards. The first player may play 1 or more cards (several cards of the same number or a straight), and the players who follow must play as many or more cards as the previous player and the total value must also be higher. Each time one or several card(s) are played, the effect of one of the played card is executed. Players who cannot play must pass. Once everyone around the table has passed, the played cards are discarded and the current players begins anew with playing one or several cards.

The first player to get rid of his hand wins the round. The game is played for several rounds, with the winner of the previous round getting an advantage for the next round.

Game description from the publisher:

It's the distant future, and mankind has taken a galactic leap forward through space, time, and technology. Life as we know it struggles to endure on the Abaddon. Once the home of a mysterious, non-human civilization, the planet is now a desolate wasteland bearing one immensely precious resource: Feronium power crystals. The unimaginable energy contained within the crystals is coveted by two groups of humans: the Satellite City-States and the Commonwealth Alliance. Using Links – giant bio-mech suits made from modified military vehicles and alien technology – the warring factions fight a weary battle for territorial control of the Abaddon.

At your disposal in Abaddon is a 28" x 19" battlefield game board with 32 highly-detailed mech figurines, 18 free-standing landscape terrain features, over 100 game-changing Wild Fire and Weapon System cards, dozens of tokens, battle dice and a Battle Manual containing over 15 mission scenarios. Choose your allegiance and lead your army in non-stop excitement as you forge through unforgiving terrain, fight to overcome random and bizarre technological glitches, and battle your enemies in never-ending war.

Abaddon is a furious, two-to-four-player game of futuristic combat. Each scenario is laid out on the customizable battlefield game board with each side using a varying number of units. The game is played in turns during which a player rolls his Activation Dice, allowing him to "activate" certain units and move them. These mechanical units – Links – are powered by Feronium power crystals, and as they take damage these crystals are depleted. A unit that runs out of crystals is unable to continue functioning and is considered destroyed.

Combat is card- and dice-based. The attacker lays out his Weapon System cards, targeting defending enemy units. Once the attacker has laid out all of his planned attacks, the defender may defend with his own Weapon System cards. These cards can modify the dice rolls that are used to determine the results of the combat. Additionally, due to the experimental nature of the Links and the mysterious happenings in the Abaddon region, things can, and often will, go wrong. These malfunctions and odd happenings are represented by Wild Fire cards, the drawing of which can result in anything from possible shutdowns to anti-gravity surges.

Victory is determined based on stipulations presented by the chosen mission scenarios. Typically, victory is achieved by damaging and destroying your opponent's units by way of their power crystals. Each destroyed enemy crystal is worth one victory point, which players must collect in order to win.

ZOMBIE APOCALYPSE is a Card Game of survival horror where 2-4 players each control groups of Humans and Zombies in an effort to survive the Zombie Apocalypse. Humans are greatly outnumbered, but are able to use Weapons and Refuges for protection. Cards like Zombie Horde and Reinforcements can quickly change momentum, but be especially careful of the Zombie Apocalypse card which always keeps the Humans' chances of survival slim at best. In the end, the player with the most Humans and Zombies left standing (or shamblimg), as well as in their Kill Pile, is declared the winner.
    With various "Theme Decks" available (which pushes the number of unique cards in the game to nearly 300), there is a simplified Deck Building system in place that allows some customization while keeping deck strengths equal. Deck Building is more about "atmosphere" than anything else in ZA.
    Finally, all cards use stunning photography! Each card bleeds creepiness and dark humor unlike anything ever seen in a Zombie card game.

The Earth is probably doomed, and rumors and speculation run rampant. Newspaper headlines from across the globe stir the populace to desperation:

"MELTING POLAR ICE CAPS" "RISING SEA LEVELS" "POLLUTION!" "OVERPOPULATION!" "NUCLEAR WINTER?" "RAVENOUS BLACK STAR GOATS?" "WILL METEORS STRIKE YOUR CHILDREN?" "DISASTER LOOMS!"

The race to escape Earth has begun! With the world's nations in decline, powerful corporations now stand as humanity's last hope. Take the reins of one such corporation, as CEO, and venture out into space. With your mission in hand; build ships, collect resources, research technologies, survive the dangers of space exploration, and, while ticket sales hold steady, preserve the human race. Remember to stay a step ahead of competing corporations, which can use slick marketing campaigns and 10 cent tchotchkes to buy the loyalty of the people you just saved from certain doom!

In Disaster Looms!, players are rewarded points for sticking to the mission and building colonies, and saving colonists. As you are a CEO you are also rewarded points for filling the Corporate treasury, and building the company's value proposition by retaining rights to the best technologies. Gameplay is fast, and exciting. Events, and the vast variety of hazards that space has to offer will keep you on your toes, and your underlings busy on the paperwork for decades to come!

The game is played in five phases:  Research, Fleet, Management, Revenue, and finally First Player Turn Auction. All players will complete each phase, in turn order, before proceeding to the next phase. This helps to keep the game moving, and keeps players engaged. In Research phase players can pay to research, or choose to license another players tech. In the Fleet phase players get one action with each ship they own. The Management phase is when players build new ships, special tech items, and sell technology to the public domain. The Revenue phase is when players collect their hard earned resources, including a small stipend from their home office on Earth. And finally, the turn auction phase is a bidding war for who goes first. Not that important at the start of the game, but monumental for the end.

Objective: be the first collecting 5 knowledge cards out of 5 different (coloured) theme areas:
versions & technology
milestones
sports
design
innovation & environment

 - moving by turn - 
During player's turn die is rolled, may move into any direction, but not vice versa; occupied spaces may be crossed.
Appropriate card is drawn, pick up question - if the answer is correct keep the card.
 Board, 5 x 50 cards with more than 1000 questions
24 action cards, 6 meeples, 1 die, rule sheet

Schlock Mercenary: Capital Offensive is a multi-player tactical shooter, played on a grid-based modular map, set in the popular Schlock Mercenary epic science fiction webcomic created by Howard Tayler. Players take on the roles of Tagon's Toughs and a variety of other characters while working to achieve scenario-specific goals.

Schlock Mercenary: Capital Offensive includes roughly one hundred pieces of original artwork, including top down floor tiles, plasma cannons, scanners, turrets, Teraport cages, and more. The game includes several scenarios, with more scheduled for release in future years.

Featured characters from the comic are Tagon, Elf, Schlock, Ennesby, Legs, Thurl, Kevin, Shodan, Elizabeth, Petey, and Partnership Collective Drones.

Tinker-bell game.

Players try to get rid of all of their glass balls. First a player draws a card with a number or a simple calculation like 3-1, and then the player throws a die which shows either - or +. If the die shows +, player puts as many glass balls as was written on the card on the flower in the middle of the board. If the die shows - player takes glass balls from the flower. When the flower falls down, player has to take all the fallen glass balls.

The aim of the game is to collect all 5 of your rescue cards by remembering where they are.

There is a big spinner in the middle of the table and players spin Fireman Sam as hard as they can!
If he stops by your marker, listen carefully to what is said.

Depending what Fireman Sam said player draws one or two rescue cards and if it is his hero on that card he takes it on his hand or if it's not puts it back in the circle around spinner.
But sometimes Norman is in trouble! Now player have to give back randomly one of his rescue card.

The first player to collect all their 5 hero cards wins!

Objective: Using the detailed street map of Mainz & Wiesbaden each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

Objective: Using the detailed street map of Duisburg each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Contents: 80 cards, 8 counters, 3 dice, rules and city information.

Objective: Using the detailed street map of Frankfurt each player is given five companies to be established in the city as close to the centre as possible.

With the help of dice and counters, each players chooses where to place, turn or remove company tiles.
Once a company is established on the map, the corresponding four 'places worth seeing' are revealed, so familiarizing players with the sights of the city.

Three old men and a small child all sit around a small duck pond, tossing breadcrumbs into the water. With each ripple from a crumb, ducks race toward the new treat. (They never actually get the snack, due to the wily fish just below the surface, but it doesn't dissuade them from trying!) Passersby watch the scene for a moment, then smile, charmed by these four people idling away their time. Little do they realize that these crafty individuals actually have a standing wager: Each has chosen a color of duck in the pond as his own, and whoever can gather his ducks into a group first gets to choose the adventure for the day!

Feed the ducks is a board game for two to four players. Each game lasts about 20 minutes. Players drop breadcrumbs into the pond, in order to attract the ducks. There are ducks in 4 colors. The first player to coerce all the ducks of his color into a single group wins.

The basic set includes components for a 2-player game. In order to play 3- or 4-player games you need the additional ducks and counters (red and blue).

MATERIAL

This is what you need in order to play Feed the ducks:

- A board depicting a pond with 61 hexagonal spaces.

- 12 white ducks, 12 black ducks (plus 8 red ducks and 6 blue ducks optionally).

- A breadcrumb (not included)

- One white counter, one black counter (plus one red counter and one blue counter optionally).

- A carrying case.

Pairs draw cards which have body parts, for example fingers-fingers or thumb-forehead and the pair has to place card between those body parts. Pairs continue to add more cards, when first card falls the game is over for that pair.

Objective: "Après-Ski" implicates party ==>
20 different party games, splitted into

Games using dice: "Herr Pes", "Mäxchen", "Schweinejagd", "Spaß im Glas", "Eisbär", "Crash Down".

Games using cards: "Mogeln", "Kartenblasen", "Kartenklopfen", "Mau Wau", "Pech gehabt", "Nummer 7", "Paare finden".

Games for groups: "Kommando Pümperle", "Rippl Dippl", "Handgemenge", "Peter und Paul".

Communication games: "Obacht"(caution ==> pantomime and describing - mini 'Activity'), "Gefragt" (questioned ==> associate words) a und "Wörter finden" (building words - 'Pass the Bomb' without bomb), equipped with 55 question cards.  
If someone 'fails' during a game he/she is collecting a 'Gaudipunkt' (= penalty), which immidiately leads to prior defined consequences (addult game)

more or less all of these small games had been already published by Piatnik years/decades ago - they are muddled along
into a mini edition

This game is built the biggest guild by the winner. The players take any shops and building, and the guild is more spread with special ranked people.

The order is decided by the auction as one time. The turn player take the building from one of kingdoms, and place in own player's area, or take any materials from own building, additionally
can take the help from one of kingdom.
Each player has the player's area in the front. The building cards are placed as like a pyramid to upper side.
Then the special ranked people also are placed as like a pyramid to downside.
Any cards are pointed.

However, sometimes the war is occurred.
Each player uses the worriers in the player's area. When lose, the player will lose a building. In the worst case, the special ranked people will leave.

The beautiful kingdom cards are drawn the icon in both sides. The helps change at each round. And in one game, some of the kingdom cards are used; players can play the different kingdoms at every time.
Many building cards are not only produced any materials, also changed any materials to other materials and products. The other building can keep more materials and worriers, and so on.
The materials are many cubes. They are used in order to build the great building and the special ranked people.

This is the card game, but the volume is same with the middle sides of board game.

From the publisher:
New children game from Tactic, where each player takes a roll of a small monster, who is looking to grow and get scarier.
Each player has a small board in front of them where they have 5x3 table of circles which needs to be filled with food.
Game has 12 different foods (drinks, hamburgers etc) Each row must have 5 different foods, but at least 1 drink.
When you are able to complete a row, you will receive a small special ability which helps you to get bigger faster and easier.
Monsters go around the board and collect food with different tasks (dice oriented tasks) and watch put from each other.
There are 4 monsters together and each one has their own abilities.
The first one to fill the board is the winner.

Somewhere in Europe, near a big sea, there is a small village called Leiuatajateküla (Inventors Village), where it is thought as honor to be able to build and invent your own stuff. Every year they have a competition for inventions.
Who is the best inventor in the city? Maybe someone who can build a plane from paper and a string or a tractor from a old trumpet. Join in to take part in the best ever competition that ever was. This is a fast and tricky board game for 2 to 5 little inventors and fans of Lotte (Estonian animation), in where you have a lot of fun and no one will get hurt. Game fits for smaller and larger players, for academic and for school kids. Who wouldn't want to adventure with rabbit Adalbert and cat Bruno?
Be the first to finish your invention and score most with it to win the game.

In Monster Factory, the players take turns drawing and placing tiles, either adding to their own monsters or to those of their opponents. The goal is to make monsters that are big, but not so big that they go unfinished.

Nina Paley did the original art, with Marco Morte coloring it.

Objective: keep on moving - do not meet (feed) a devil (4 of  
           them)
           find the correct answers for question cards
           cooperative game
moving by turn - drawing cards
story:
Family Grünkern (= 'unripe spelt grains') moves all over the board. If you flip a card find the correct answer - otherwise you will feed the 'devil marker' 
Questions like 'may you catch butterflies?' or
'may you drop a magazine onto a compost heap?'
content:
1   board
4   coloured meeples 
2   dice
1   enviromental little devil
4   polluters
143 cards
1   schedule/scheme
1   rules

With this game, children learn about geography, particularly topography. On the game board an illustrated map of the world is depicted. The continents are each in a different color, so they can be distinguished easily. The countries are easy to find by numbers and colors. At the edge of the board flags are shown.

The game contains 110 illustrated cards with questions (and answers) such as: Where do polar bears live? Where is the Eiffel Tower located? Background information, continents, countries and people pass by. Players have to respond the correct country, continent or ocean and have to designate them on the world map. By doing this correctly chips can be earned. The first player who has collected 8 chips wins the game.

The rules also describe a second way of playing. Here 24 random cards are put face up in the middle of the game board. The players take turns throwing a die and moving their pawn in accordance on the flags around the game board. They have to collect cards by selecting cards from the middle which are related to the country their pawn landed on. If no such a card is available, the player just has bad luck. Once a player reaches the last field, the player with the most cards wins.

WELTRAUMFAHRT is a roll-and-move dice game which was published around 1960.
What makes it special is the highly attractive artwork and the beautiful playing pieces shaped as small astronauts, which glow in the dark...

Objective: collect as many winning chips as possible

close to the rules of the popular TV-show you try to mislead your opponents placing your meeple as short as possible before the jingle is sounding onto 'true area'
the magic pen shows the correct answer (out of 3) and you should get a chip if you were right
 content:
- board
- magic pen
- 198 x 2 question & answer cards 
- 90 chips
- 9 meeples
- rules
battery is needed (for magic pen working)
depending on edition no. of cards may vary

In Zombies ate my Brains (ZAMB) you are a newly created Zombie just trying to get some fresh human brains to keep you in peek undead form. Those pesky living ones however seem to want you dead, for real this time. Can you eat their brains before they destroy your rotting body? Find out if you have the right stuff come the Zombie Apocalypse.

ZAMB is a solo card game in which you have 2 decks, one is your play deck and the other is the Humans. You also have a set of cards to represent you the Zombie- which as you take damage changes your ability to draw cards and also effects your defence and offensive capabilities. Gameplay involves managing whatever the humans throw at you and using your hand/deck you try to defeat the game as more and more threats come into play. Picking the wrong option is deadly to the undead.

The Zombies over run the world and win if there are no more human cards left to play and yet your undead minion is still in (at least) one piece.

The game is a fast playing light card game which can also  be played as a 2 player format with one player taking control of the Humans. In solo play the game rarely goes over 10 minutes play time.

For untold centuries a war has been waged in the shadows cast by the moon. Two great powers of the underworld clash in repetitive fury, fighting for ultimate supremacy. The hedonistic Vampires believe it to be their birthright to own the night. The untamed Werewolves believe that none other than themselves should  master the Earth. Whose claim is true? When twilight descends, which species will set the ancient records in stone and prove their powers of domination? Time to settle old scores. It’s time to Bare Your Fangs!

Bare Your Fangs is a two-player dice fighting game devoted to resolving once and for all which species will reign supreme: Vampire or Werewolf. Players choose their faction dice and roll to attack! The fully customized die icons determine successful hits, blocks, and of course, one’s ability to hunt for humans and thereby heal wounds incurred in these savage battles. But there is always risk. Some humans won’t go down without a fight! And one particular human seeks only the total annihilation of all creatures of the night.  The Werewolf’s physical power is unmatched but the Vampire’s ability to heal is legendary. Only one will rule when dawn breaks, but will the victor crush his opponent into oblivion and take his rightful place as Leader Eternal, or will the fang fray destroy them both!

Spears action game.

THe board has 8 sections, with a goal at the appropriate at every alternate side. If two play, opposite sections are played. If four play, then all goal-sections are used.

Each player has a 'puffer', a miniature bellows that, when pressed, ejects a stream of air. The object is to 'blow' the ball around the board, trying to get it into an opponent's goal.

The first to score 6 goals is the winner.

Objective: collect as many bonus points as possible

- roll & move game with action cards; moving by turn -
Each player tries to roll & move, picking up cards, helping enviroment and moving his/her stone along the scoring board/row
for more involved detectives (age 10..) a 'tracing set' can be added

Content:
1  board
5  wooden meeples (= 'Öko-detectives') 
5  wooden stones (scoring)
1  special 6-sided wooden die
30 wooden chips
26 event cards
12 cards for environmental sins
8  action slides
5  tracing-set-cards
1  rules

"In Search of Eldorado" (In search of Eldorado) is a strategy game involving 2 teams (expeditionaries and indigenous) that can be composed of 1, 2 or 3 players each

The expeditionaries mission is a sea voyage aboard their galleons, from its port to the land of the Indians.

There are 3 pyramids spread over the territory of these.

Below one of the 3 pyramids is Eldorado. It'll be known by the brand that bears on the base. The only ones who know which of the pyramids is marked are the Indians.

The aim of the expedition will be to find and seize the pyramid that contains Eldorado and take it to the port where the expedition departed.

The Indians will be guarding the 3 pyramids, thus hindering the expeditionaries discovering which of them is Eldorado.

His other mission will be hunt down and eliminating the expeditionaries as soon as they land.

If any of the expeditionaries manages to find and grab the pyramid of Eldorado, the Indians will use all means at its disposal by land and sea to recover and return the pyramid of Eldorado to their place of origin.

The members of each team will decide among them wich piece they move each turn.

Severed Union 1861-1865 is a historical miniature wargame, which is the first release from Gordon & Hague War-Games.  The game uses 10mm pre-painted wargame miniatures to allow players to relive the greatest battles of the American Civil War.  This game is a turn based in which each player will take turns moving, firing and charging.  There are multiple ways to win according to what style of game you are playing.  There are "take and hold" battles where you must capture key objectives around the battlefield in a specified amount of turns or simply play a "total destruction" game where you must destroy the enemy and run them from the tabletop!

The miniatures are 10mm in scale and pre-painted and are ready for battle right out of the box.  The Severed Union Rulebook is free to download from our the Gordon & Hague website.  There is an advanced 40 page rulebook for veteran war-gamers and there is also a 4 page quick-start rulebook for newcomers and children.

The game mechanics are based mainly around dice rolling and measuring.  Maneuvering your units is also very important as you receive bonuses for being on high-ground and in or behind protective cover such as fences, buildings and forests.

The war is over.  Humanity has regained control.  The zombies have been rounded up and contained.  Time for people to get on with their lives.  But there's no TV; no internet; society needs time to rebuild.  What will the masses do for entertainment?

Zombie Roller Derby.  In this game, you take the role of a roller derby team manager.  Your team consists of "trained" zombies; your goal is to win the race, and maybe kill a few zombies along the way.

Race your zombies along the derby track.  Play cards to urge them forward or to fight other zombies.  Avoid the ire of the crowd, or stir them up on purpose.  Play to win; to kill zombies; or to incite a riot.  Just don't let the zombies get out of their cages...

HOCKEY BLAST is an "old-school" card-chart-and-dice simulation of pro hockey. Primarily designed as a solitaire game for sports board game hobbyists, it can also be played head-to-head, with each player making decisions for his team.  It was introduced by PLAAY Games in April of 2010.

The game differs significantly from similarly-themed hockey games in a number of ways.

First, it re-creates hockey action totally differently than existing games like APBA and Strat-O-Matic.  Rather than re-creating a hockey game pass-by-pass and shot-by-shot, HOCKEY BLAST re-creates the action minute-by-minute.  The game charts crystallize each minute's action, and a unique "lull" mechanism allows the gamer to fast-forward past uneventful minutes.  The result is a hockey game that plays quickly, yet captures all the nuances and excitement of real hockey.

Second, HOCKEY BLAST realistically incorporates momentum and fights into the game play. In HOCKEY BLAST, a team plays better when it has momentum.  It can gain momentum in a number of ways--by landing a big hit, scoring a goal, making a spectacular save, or having one of its players win a fight. In other hockey games, fights can occur, but have no real effect on the game other than to send participants to the penalty box.  In HOCKEY BLAST, the classic hockey "enforcer" persona has a real role, just as in real hockey.

Another way HOCKEY BLAST is different is that it provides fans with instructions on how to rate their own players and teams.  The company encourages this, and even posts user-created card sets for free download on its website, www.plaay.com.

The game comes in a two-piece labeled box with a game book that contains all the necessary charts, a hockey rink game board, a set of strategy cards, dice, markers for momentum and penalties, an instructions booklet, scoresheets, and two sample teams.  Full player card sets based on historical pro hockey seasons are available, along with a fictional player card series that is updated annually.

GB Racers: The Ultimate Car Racing Board Game (Second Edition)

Strap in for the ride of your life in this fast-paced Formula 1 simulation board game.

Appleton Games proudly presents GB Racers (Golden Ball Racers), a fast-paced game inspired by F1 Racing.  This exciting new F1 Racing board game infusing the ‘Appleton Way’ a sporting chance of success for everyone, every time.

You can play as 1 player using all 6 teams of 12 cars, or up to 6 players combined using the historical GB Racer cards.  Also experience the unique GB (Golden Ball) 20 sided dice and other special features.

GB Racers board game is for 1 – 6 players, where you have 2 racing cars each and must get 77 points or more to win the GB Championship. This you do by picking up points for both cars during several GB Grand Prix races. Each race takes 12 – 20 minutes to complete & there is an average of 4 – 5 races per championship.
The overall time averages just over 1 hour.

Features
For 1-6 players
60 minute playing time

Safety Warning
Warning! Not suitable for children under 36 months due to small parts

A game published in junction with the student carnival "Lundakarnevalen 2010". The game is a word-game, where players try to descibe words without mentioning specifics (very similar to Alias).

Players take turn to try to describe the words on the card, each one with a specific theme, without mentioning the specific word or part of the word. The other players, teammates or opponents depending on the variant, try to guess as many as possible in a set period of time; and players score accordingly. First one to a set target of points is the winner.

What sets the game apart from Alias is the distinct tongue-in-cheek "lundahumor", i.e. humour from the student city of Lund. The themes and words on the different cards are often odd, screwball or intergroup.

In addition to the original rules, several variants is included in the base-game.

Objective: Collect as many cheese cake pieces as possible by moving around the board
 - moving/acting by turn -
each player has to collect cheese cake pieces for Diddle. You can achieve this if you have to draw a question card => give the right answer  or
if you draw an action card => perform required action properly
If all players are back in Diddls' cave the one who gained most of the pieces wins

Rules for game: First, place the animals (Elephant, Alligator, Camel, Zebra, Lion and Goat) on the board using set up rules , then 1st player rolls dice and then can do any of 3 things.

1) Place hunter on the board and then move him the total of both dice

or

2) place hunter on board move him total of 1 die then place second hunter on board and move him total of 2nd die

or

3) start hunter move him total of 1 die then place peg on board horizontally or vertically the distance away from hunter equal to the 2nd die.

Object of the game is to continue to make those die rolls and try and to surround the animals. Game ends when all animals have been caught. Scoring is as follows: Elephant, Alligator and Camel= 4 points. Zebra and Lion = 3 points and Goat = 2 points.

Straddle is a skill-action party game played on a giant planisphere (5 ft x 6 ft plastic playing mat) and combines a fun mix of practical and observational astronomy. Playing like Hasbro’s classic Twister game, the object is to touch a star or constellation using only your feet or hands and be the last player not to touch any other body part to the mat.

Each player stands at a corner of the mat in socks or bare feet. The umpire spins the spinner and calls out the body part and the star or constellation, for example, left hand Orion. The first player puts his or her left hand on the constellation Orion. Using the supplied star charts, the umpire can help a player determine what stars are in the constellation. Play continues to the next player.

If a player touches the mat with any body part except a hand or a foot, that player is eliminated. Be the last player not to touch any other body part to the Straddle mat to win the game.

After the retirement of captain "White Beard", the crew of a pirate ship decides do rotate positions. Each round, a new player becomes captain and pick roles for everybody else. In order, the pirates take a treasure (pearls, diamonds, rubys, emeralds or rum barrels) from a hand of cards. Precious stones translate into victory points and rum barrels confer "special powers" to the players who hold them. But not all treasures will be banked safely - Spanish, French and English pirate-hunters will force the crew to discard some cards along the game.

Empires and Generals is a Print and Play Collectible Card Game with free content available from EmpiresandGenerals.com.

You play as a famous Empire from real history against other Empires from real history using Generals, Soldiers, Ideals, Strategies, Tactics and Resources from their own unique Empire.

The object of Empires and Generals is to become the greatest and most powerful Empire. You can do this by gaining Cultural Health or by causing others to lose theirs.

To date the "Family Edition" is free to print and that includes:

The Huns
Roman Republic
Egyptian Kingdom
Ancient China

The Expanded Edition includes:

Ancient Greece 
Achaemenid Persia
and more

And other expansions include:

Act of God Thematic Expansion
The Prince Thematic Expansion
The Great Plague

Using Playing Cards and Resource Cards you build your Empire. Build your Kingdom with Civilization-specific cards. Send your Soldiers out to the Battlefield with the General in the lead. Utilize Strategies and Tactics to suit your personal playing system.

Pick an Empire to represent.

After determining the length of game-play, dominate your opponent by destroying their army or hide behind your walls and win by cunning.

Squava is a derivative of Yavalath with the same goal but different components. It is intended to be a small simple game.

It is played on a 5×5 square board. 2 players (White and Black) alternate turns placing a pawn of their colour on an empty space of the board.

Players strive to make a line of 4 pieces of their colour, but lose if they make a line of 3 before doing so. Lines can be orthogonal or diagonal.

Boolean is an abstract strategy game that uses the concepts of Boolean Logic to play. At first created as a learning tool by College Professor Edu Jacober, Boolean was published in 2011 by Ceilikan Jogos. It is now out of print.

Boolean is actually a game system and comes with two distinct sets of rules. The board represent a logic circuit with boolean operations that can be changed by playing cards on the game board.

Basic rules: Players are either black or white (0 or 1) and, by setting the logic gates on the game board, try to get their team to score more points. In your turn you can: a) buy a card, b)play a card. Circuit inputs are driven by a FIFO line

Advanced rules: Players are also either black or white and, by setting logic gates on the game board, try to get their team to score more points. In your turn you can: A) buy a card, b) play a card, c) feed a free input with a piece from your score track. Circuit inputs are copied from gameboard latches existent on more valuable locations in the gameboard.
"Can you ride skateboard - Only when I'm sitting in the bus." This fun party question and answer game for any number of children provides 2700 possible combinations of questions and answers.

Game designed to help children with their maths. A set in this version are a number of cards that form a correct equation. For example; a three card set could be 4 divided by 2 = 2.

A promotional game, by Kellogg's

Indoor golf game. Nine metal 'holes' are included. They are odd shapes so that each hole will play differently, rather like an indoor version of Crazy Golf.

No publisher credited or a date of release. The illustration on the box looks like it is from the 20's or 30's.

Japanese version of Mahjong for children.
Goal of the game is to collect 3 sets of 4 tiles, and say Punch!
Tiles have pictures of animals.

Later versions Ponjan/Pom Jong (by Anoa, later trademark of Tomy) and Donjara (by Bandai) the goal was to collect 3 sets of 3 tiles. Games have minor differences in how points are counted, but essentially the rules are same. New versions usually have pictures of animation characters, but there are other versions like one with girls from idol group AKB48.

In Search for Gnomes, players attempt to remember as many gnomes as possible in about 15 seconds time. Each round, every player tries to find the right amount of gnomes for each mission played, and after six rounds (in a two-player game) or four rounds (with four players) whoever has the most points wins.

To set up a round, the starting player shuffles the twenty mission tiles face down, then shuffles the 25 forest tiles face up, placing them in a 5x5 grid. Everyone tries to remember as many gnomes and colors as possible, then after 15 seconds, they turn the forest tiles face down. Then each player in turn takes and reveals a mission tile after which a bidding round begins, with players bidding on how well they can complete the mission tiles.

Objective: be the first who collected 5 stars answering question cards correctly
 - moving/acting by turn -
luxuriant equipped game 
roll the dice, draw a card, answer question (out of world of dinner & drinks, recipes ..) correctly - multiple choice/possible multiple answers
selection/samples of questions:
what is tartar?
A  stone growing on grapes
B  small crystalline residues 
C  stone needed to press grapes

Variation of DKT with a satirical theme. Money is transferred to the Bahamas and Liechtenstein, in the end all Tickets are sold to the state and the rest of the money in the bank - that still exist - all players divided, whoever has the most money wins.

There is a journey along a path of hazards and barriers and
players "cooperate" creatively to innovate solutions that let them get home together.

The first path card is laid on the middle of the table and every player plays one tool card from the hand and explains how it could be used to overcome the obstacle on the path card. Then the all players together discuss about the solutions and decide which are the best or how to obsatcle is solved with those tools. If the solution have found all tools are discarded and the next path board is laid out for next round.

There are options for length of play and alternate rules to extend interest in the game. For 2 to 5 players.

Contents:

     25 path cards 
     100 tool cards.

Slasher Movie is a game of Survival Horror, Detection, and Betrayal for 2-6 Players. In Slasher Movie, you play as a character in your very own horror movie. You can play the game trying to save Victims from the various Slashers in your town. Or, you may try to discover who’s responsible for the latest killing. But beware, one of your fellow players may also be a Slasher, ready to strike when you least expect it. What’s more, You may be a Slasher yourself, plotting the demise of everyone else.

Players are gangster that must keep their territories safe from others. Move your pawns in New York, trying to reach a secret objectives to win the game.

In your struggle, you will have help of warriors that will fight with punches, kicks and other martial arts skills, but be aware, if you loose a battle, your will loose your warrior and will be an easy target.

How can you forge ahead through the jeweled walls of the mine shaft? Shift them! Rotate a game tile a quarter turn to move the mine wall and allow your gemstone access. Or rotate tiles to prevent your opponent from moving. There are walls everywhere, but strategic miners can successfully make their way through to the other side. With 27 game board tiles, the set-ups are unlimited for a brand new game every time you play. 2 players.

From their web site:

Tabuals is a deck of 43 cards; 36 of which are considered the core deck with each card depicting a pair of dice of varying combinations. In addition to the core deck, there are 6 additional cards called the Starred Doubles. Although the core deck already contains a pair of each double combintation (double 1's, double 2's, etc.), the Starred Doubles is a second set of doubles denoted by a star to the right of their sum (or rank). This extra set is only used in some of our games to change various game mechanics. Finally, the last card in the deck is the JINX card. This card is also only utilized in some of our games.

There are many types of games that can be played with a deck of Tabuals:

Solitaire Gamesâ€¨
Trick-Taking Gamesâ€¨

Building Gamesâ€¨
Melding Games

From the website:
PUKEMASTER gets every party started, and is a brilliant drinking game for both single and team players. During the game you will face several challenges, which you help to develop. You’re the one who sets the limit!

If you’re not in a festive mood after playing PUKEMASTER, you haven’t played it right!

The board game has a very cheeky and smooth design. You can just wipe of the game board, if you should spill.The game board is magnetic, hence you can play the game everywhere – on the bus, at the festival, at the beach, or in the park.

The game board measures 16x16x4 cm. That’s why it is so easy to carry with you. When the magnetic game board is folded out, it measures only 30×30 cm. Perfect for the bar desk, at your favorite bar!

Munchkin Apocalypse is a core set in the Munchkin series with an end of the world theme that includes natural disasters, zombie takeovers, Armageddon, alien invasions, nuclear war, etc. And while this is still a standard Munchkin game where you try to level up by killing the monsters, stealing the treasure, and stabbing your buddy, there's a new "Seal" mechanic that significantly changes the gameplay.

Seals are a reference to the biblical seals of the Apocalypse. They can be opened and closed, although it's typically more difficult to close them. Once seven Seals are open, the game ends immediately, and the player with the highest combat strength (excluding levels) is the winner. The Seal mechanic adds a sense of impending doom to the game, meant to mimic the sense of impending doom for a real apocalypse. It also tends to create situations where the group works together to close a Seal in order to prevent a player from winning via the Seal mechanic. So there is more teamwork than in a regular Munchkin game.

The balance of the deck is also different than the other Munchkin sets. There are a lot more Disaster cards, which are equivalent to traps and curses, so bad things tend to occur more frequently. Also, there are more monsters, especially high-level monsters. To offset this, however, there are more item enhancers and high-bonus items. It's been stated in the Munchkin forums that Munchkin Apocalypse is harder to play and is intended more for seasoned Munchkin veterans.

Munchkin Apocalypse has four new classes but does not have races, powers, or other "thingies". It includes Undead and Shark monsters, which follow special rules.

The game comes with 180 cards (92 Doors, 76 Treasures, 12 Seals). The Seal cards are a different size than the regular cards--they're square and are shorter but wider (2.75" x 2.75"). The included d6 is orange with lime green pips, similar in color to the orange dice in the +6 Bag o' Radioactive Munchkin d6.
